headline: Coronavirus Cases in U.S. Are Rising, Even as Death Rates Trend Down
snippet: The country’s daily infection report topped 50,000 again. Yet the virus appears to be killing fewer of the people it infects. Catch up on the latest.
abstract: At least five U.S. states set single-day records on Friday as the country’s daily infection report passed 50,000 again. President Trump, in a speech at Mount Rushmore, barely mentioned the pandemic.

headline: The Science of School Reopenings
snippet: Several countries have found ways to reopen schools safely. But can the United States?
abstract: Several countries have found ways to reopen schools safely. But can the United States?

headline: Russian Interference, Angela Merkel, Afghan Women: Your Wednesday Briefing
snippet: Here’s what you need to know.
abstract: Here’s what you need to know.

headline: Trump, in a Departure, Says Virus Will Get Worse
snippet: The landmark deal includes steps to help less wealthy countries, such as giving much of the money as grants. Here’s the latest.
abstract: More than 20,000 members of the U.S. military have contracted the virus, and the infection rate has soared recently. Major security flaws were found in a South Korean quarantine app.

headline: Inside Trump’s Failure: The Rush to Abandon Leadership Role on the Virus
snippet: The nation’s inability to control the pandemic can be traced to mid-April, when the White House embraced rosy projections to proclaim victory and move on.
abstract: The roots of the nation’s current inability to control the pandemic can be traced to mid-April, when the White House embraced overly rosy projections to proclaim victory and move on.
byline: By Michael D. Shear, Noah Weiland, Eric Lipton, Maggie Haberman and David E. Sanger

headline: Fauci Back at the White House, a Day After Trump Aides Tried to Undermine Him
snippet: The visit underscored a reality for both President Trump and his most prominent coronavirus adviser, Dr. Anthony Fauci: They are stuck with each other.
abstract: The visit underscored a reality for both the president and his most prominent coronavirus adviser: They are stuck with each other.
byline: By Michael D. Shear and Noah Weiland

headline: As Trump Demanded Schools Reopen, His Experts Warned of ‘Highest Risk’
snippet: A briefing packet for federal emergency response teams detailed the steps schools should take to reopen safely.
abstract: A briefing packet for federal emergency response teams details the steps schools should take to reopen safely.
byline: By Eileen Sullivan and Erica L. Green

headline: At Least 5 States Set Single-Day Coronavirus Case Records
snippet: The top health official in Tulsa, Okla., suggested that the surge was probably connected to President Trump’s campaign event. Here’s the latest.
abstract: Tulsa’s top health official said the Trump rally last month may have contributed to a local surge in cases. A study in England provided more evidence of crucial risk factors for Covid-19 deaths.

headline: Biden Warns Trump Not to ‘Hype’ Vaccines
snippet: Joe Biden’s campaign offered a snapshot of its strategy, and The Times checked back in on the top contenders to be his running mate.
abstract: The Democratic convention will require daily virus tests for attendees, and the University of Notre Dame withdrew as a debate host.

headline: Research Boosts Evidence of Masks’ Utility, Some Experts Say
snippet: Masks have long been known to prevent infected people from spreading the virus. Research now suggests they also protect the uninfected. Catch up on the latest.
abstract: Masks have long been known to help stop infected people from spreading the virus, but some research suggests they also protect the uninfected. President Trump shared a video with misinformation about the virus.

headline: As Coronavirus Cases Top 3 Million, Fauci Warns Against Misreading a Falling Death Rate
snippet: Dr. Anthony Fauci said that it was a “false narrative to take comfort in a lower rate of death.” Here’s the latest.
abstract: President Trump made it official: The U.S. is pulling out of the World Health Organization. President Jair Bolsonaro of Brazil has tested positive. Hong Kong faces a “third wave” of infections.

headline: Fauci to Testify Before Congress on Coronavirus Response
snippet: Dr. Anthony Fauci and other officials will speak at a hearing on Friday at 9 a.m. Eastern. An impasse threatened U.S. jobless aid. Catch up on the latest.
abstract: Federal U.S. jobless benefits are set to expire after lawmakers failed to make a deal. Herman Cain died after being hospitalized with the virus.

headline: Judge Blocks Green Card Wealth Tests, Citing Pandemic Hardships
snippet: A judge granted an injunction on the Trump administration’s green card plans. California and Florida set single-day death records. Catch up on the latest.
abstract: Deaths top 150,000 in the United States. A $600 unemployment benefit is likely to lapse on Friday, a top official said. In Iran, religious ceremonies and college-entrance exams are in limbo.

headline: Trump Falsely Claims Much of U.S. Is ‘Corona-Free’
snippet: Republicans included $1.75 billion in the relief proposal for a new headquarters. Democrats say it could benefit President Trump’s hotel. Here’s the latest.
abstract: A national teachers’ union said teachers might strike as a “last resort” if they didn’t feel safe. Pilgrims to Mecca are finding a reconfigured hajj.

headline: Testing Results Take Too Long, U.S. Official Concedes
snippet: The testing czar admitted results are taking too long. Florida’s tally surpassed that of New York, an early epicenter. Catch up on the latest.
abstract: Florida has now recorded more cases than New York. Britain orders travelers from Spain into 14 days of isolation, upending vacation plans for thousands.

headline: U.S. Coronavirus Cases Soar as 18 States Set Single-Day Records This Week
snippet: And Friday was the fourth day running that the United States reported over 1,100 deaths. Catch up on the latest.
abstract: Friday was the fourth day running that the United States reported over 1,100 deaths. New research sheds light on male vulnerability to severe Covid-19.

headline: Requiem for a Republican Convention
snippet: President Trump retreated on the Republican National Convention as the coronavirus pandemic continued to upend the presidential contest. In Washington, John Lewis will lie in state at the Capitol.
abstract: President Trump’s decision to cancel the Jacksonville convention underscores how the coronavirus has upended the presidential race. This afternoon, he signed several executive orders addressing the high price of drugs in the United States.

headline: 73,400 New Coronavirus Cases in U.S., Nearing Single-Day Record
snippet: As the number of cases in the U.S. has continued to climb, so has the number of hospitalizations, which had skirted its own record in recent days. Catch up here.
abstract: South Korea reported its biggest jump in new cases since March. Nancy Pelosi, pushing for a broader aid package, rejected a short extension of relief benefits.

headline: Global Coronavirus Cases Surge, Stinging Even Places That Seemed to Have Control
snippet: Troubling resurgences have hit places around the world, like Hong Kong and Tokyo, that were seen as models in the virus fight. Catch up on the latest.
abstract: Troubling resurgences have hit places around the world that were seen as models in the virus fight. In the U.S., known cases surpassed four million.
